item.title: Don't be pseudo-worker
item.description: If you’re always starting interesting projects and not finishing, then no matter how hard you work, you’re just busy, not productive. This…
item.content:encoded:
If you’re always starting interesting projects and not finishing, then no matter how hard you work, you’re just busy, not productive.

This is so true. You can easily burden yourself with tons of works without finishing anything, but just to get the feeling that “I am doing something that would make me feel good”. This is not true.

That might make you feel good, for a short period of time, but in the long run, or even in the “middle run”, you will be doomed. Actually get something done - that’s simple but not easy.

I am also on the road of being more productive, this might be an infinite journey, but any proceed will make things better.

One useful suggestion is that “build your infrastructure”, which are the things that you will be using everyday, make them as efficent as possible as they will be used many, many, many times. Personally I now have OKR, kanban, and daily todo list as the working infrastructure (of course I am still improving, look at this repo), I encourage you to make something that you use everyday as efficient as possible (or even automate them), thy shall benefit a lot. :)

item.content:encoded:
I heard about the rumours how people who loved reading so much used to read books on the tiny little mp3. I am not that insane (for the sake of my eyes), but it’s definitely needed to read pdf files on mobile.

Sadly my android chrome doesn’t support this. I tried to get around with it using google drive for pdf previewing like this: https://docs.google.com/viewerng/viewer?url=yoururlonserver, that was OK, but the connection tends to be slow, and I’d prefer hosting things myself. Better find another way around.

So here it is: pdf.js by mozilla, this totally solved my problem. And I also found : a descendant project using react. I am currently working on making the demos, you should also give it a shot!

item.content:encoded:
Configurations

Gatsby root import plugin

yarn add --dev gatsby-plugin-root-import

Add this line to gatsby-config.js: ‘gatsby-plugin-root-import’.

Make scss module available

yarn add gatsby-plugin-sass node-sass@4.14.1

Don’t just use yarn add node-sass, the version is in conflict with other modules by now (2020-11-04). Add this line to gatsby-config.js: ‘gatsby-plugin-root-import’. Then I can use import scss file as a module.

Building

Remove defaults

Remove bio.js and modify the rest, making it more customized.

NavBar

Add navbar.js to /src/components, <ul><li><Link> should be your friend. Import navbar in files you like (index.js or layout.js or more)
